text: Yes, You’re looking for child pages
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/dynamic-pages/hubdb/multilevel>
More specifically you need to enable “Enable pages for child tables”

thanks Kieran, i have implemented it this way with *multilevel dynamic pages.* my only concern is now i have alot of tables in my database and i don't know if that is a good practise. what are your thoughts about that? is it ok to have the content devided in multiple tables? i cant find any tutorials to see how a good hubDB database is structured
any thoughts on that?
If you want multi-level pages, theres not really another option. This is, unfortunately the limitation.
Thanks for the info!

It might be a caching thing. I would log out of the system and back in to see if that resolves the issue. We’ve seen this here and there from what I recall but it usually clears itself. If you continue having issues, I would reach out to support.

Hey there, we don’t currently have any announced workshops/trainings right now. You can see some of our more recent events and recordings on our blog <https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/>

We definitely will be doing more events in the future. At this time however I don’t have any specific dates to announce.

Additionally we post recordings of past events on our YouTube Channel as well as our monthly Community Developer Podcast, and now Developer Bytes - short form educational video content.
<https://www.youtube.com/c/HubSpotDevelopers/playlists>
Thanks Jon! We’ll sit tight and hope for something in the future. I’ll check out recordings in the meantime.

We also have some free developer content in HubSpot academy that may be useful to you and your team
<https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses?page=1#topics=web_development,web_design;certsOnly=false>;
ok, will try this.  Thank you!
Hey there. Does anyone know if there's a keyboard shortcut to "Clear styles" in HubSpot's content editor?

Greetings. We had a manual accessibility test performed on one of our pages and the forms have a couple errors. Has anyone run into this and/or have solutions for these? Any help is greatly appreciated.

1. Error messages aren’t being read by screen readers.
2. From the auditor in regards to fieldsets. “All fieldset elements should be labeled with legend elements. The first child element inside a fieldset must be a legend element, which provides a label or description for the group. legend elements in other positions may be ignored.”
Thank you!
Since blog multilanguage is released, how can I use `{{content.translated_content}}` on a blog listing? It works fine on a blog post.
Nvm, found the solution! <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/multi-language-content>

I have an HTML element that I want to be able to know if a lead has interacted with on their journey to conversion. Is there a simple way to do this? As far as I can tell using the contacts API won’t work because they haven’t converted yet. My other idea was to try and rig up a CTA click event on the element or as a last resort, use a cookie or local storage and pipe that into a hidden form field when they convert.
Are you on enterprise?
<@U38EZFVFE> I am!
